column4: to remove a covering like a curtain from a new structure at a formal ceremony in order to show the opening or finishing of a new building or work of art
a situation in which you do not have things or conditions that are usually considered necessary for a pleasant life
to grow develop or be successful
to say firmly or demand forcefully especially when others disagree with or oppose what you say
the part of the body between the hand and the arm
a list of the parents and other relations of an animal
necessary or needed for a particular purpose
a person who has had a lot of experience of a particular activity
(of a person or their behaviour) slightly dishonest or not speaking the complete truth
to receive money a house etc. from someone after they have died
to take control or possession of foreign land or a group of people  by force
to arrange dishonestly for the result of something for example an election to be changed
to remove earth that is covering very old objects buried in the ground in order to discover things about the past
the body or frame of a ship most of which goes under the water
a rectangular hole in a piece of wood stone etc. into which another piece is fixed so that they form a joint
the end of a piece of wood that is shaped to fit into a mortise (= an opening) in another piece of wood to form a joint
by which way or method
heavy matter such as sand or stone that is used at the bottom of a ship or a hot-air balloon to make it heavier  or the small stones on which railways and roads are made
trees that are grown so that the wood from them can be used for building
a long pole with a wide  flat part at one end  used for rowing a boat
a long structure  usually built of stone  where boats can be tied up to take on and off their goods
to become smaller  or to make something smaller
to (cause to) change from a solid  frozen state to a liquid or soft one  because of an increase in temperature
the process in which the beauty or quality of something is destroyed or spoiled
happening or moving quickly or within a short time  especially in a smooth and easy way
to come together in a large group of people or animals
happening in a smooth  gradual  and regular way  not suddenly or unexpectedly
